Articles.Content:
Sorry control!

New Prototype wanna try it :-)

Lift off.

Is Kerbal that way?

There it is !

Oh Dear no Fuel Please Parachutes work!

OH My GOD Do I float!

IT DOES!!! Wheres the next rocket lets go again!
I feel like going nuts on you, not for most of your rocket, but for using parachutes on a spaceplane.

I feel like going nuts on you, not for most of your rocket, but for using parachutes on a spaceplane.

I used them on the Ibis and Kestrel. Then again, the Ibis does at least have the capability of making a landing by itself. Which is why I built it. The Kestrel was far too big, and it couldn\'t LTOL.

Now to build a Dramiel !!!!!

Hay its a back up plan if you wish to use the fuel to fly about and land you can without the parachutes :-)

Mfw noticing the parachutes.

But in all seriousness, why not attach a few heavy RCS modules that C7 provides for VTOL capability on Kerbin? It hurts to watch the ineffectiveness of parachutes... :\'(

I don\'t really care for CO2 emission looks cool and does the job lol. Not bad for a bottle rocket.

Take the parachutes off at your own risk! Apply Faith Tank!

Now to build a Dramiel !!!!!

Hay its a back up plan if you wish to use the fuel to fly about and land you can without the parachutes :-)

But the problem I have is not that your using parachutes, its that your using it on a spaceplane. Whats the point of haling the extra weight of the wings, when you are going to decend using parachutes. It makes no logical sence.
Who needs Logic when you have a space plane to go with the sharks with lasers on there heads :-)

Suddenly I realise that all this time the Kestrel was just a proof of concept, a prototype for the technologies used in the Ibis.

For it failed as a plane, though it could go to the Mun.

Suddenly I realise that all this time the Kestrel was just a proof of concept, a prototype for the technologies used in the Ibis.

For it failed as a plane, though it could go to the Mun.

Meh, I wouldn\'t see mun-capable planes too discouraging to any other planes. C7 parts are super cheaty, as it. Just get a main engine with some strong VTOL and... well that\'s pretty much it. Can\'t weigh that too heavy in judging.
Almost have a working glider version :-) no parachutes!

Meh, I wouldn\'t see mun-capable planes too discouraging to any other planes. C7 parts are super cheaty, as it. Just get a main engine with some strong VTOL and... well that\'s pretty much it. Can\'t weigh that too heavy in judging.

Thats why most of my designs have A: no RCS and B: not to be flown above 30,000m.

After your recommendations I have now completed tests for my Bomber 2 Which is now able to glide and land with no use of parachutes!

Here is a sneek peep.

This time simple is best now I glide like a feather to the earth after horizontal flight from the Mun.

Pictures and video to follow.

Need some tweaks to stabilize the landing for Mun and Kerbin. But seems good for orbital missions and High Orbit

Enjoy a little unstable but pretty stable for its size!!
